name: Office for National Statistics (ONS)
description: UK’s largest independent producer of official statistics. Publish data related to the economy, population and society at national, regional and local levels. Conduct Census every 10 years.

name: Ordnance Survey (OS)
description: UK’s national mapping agency. Provide accurate location data and 500 million geospatial features for use in geospatial analyses.

name: .gov.uk
description: A public sector information website, created by the Government Digital Service to provide a single point of access to HM Government services.

name: [Green Minds] Grafana Dashboard
description: Dashboards displaying experimental data from a variety of sensors around Plymouth, such as air quality and environmental conditions in Central Park, Senstick weather and soil sensors and LoRaWAN gateway status. Users can select and download data as a .csv file.
update_freq: Real time
use_this_to: Find out what experimental sensing is occurring in Plymouth and understand where there is opportunity to improve data collection and use, for example.

name: Stumpd Counters - Devonport and The Hoe
description: Footfall counters - Devonport park, Autumn 2019. The Hoe, Christmas 2019. “This is an evolving dataset being progressed by the Future Parks Accelerator programme”.
use_this_to: Understand the visitor numbers and movements around Plymouth Hoe and Devonport.

name: Plymouth Wildflower Meadows
description: Name, area and type of wildflower meadows in Plymouth as of November 2019.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated November, 2019.
use_this_to: Visualise the location of wildflower meadows on a map to pinpoint where it might be beneficial to create new meadows and / or corridors for pollinators and other species.

name: i-Tree tools
description: Peer-reviewed software suite that provides urban and rural forestry analysis and benefits assessment tools.
use_this_to: Strengthen forest management and advocacy efforts by quantifying forest structure and the environmental benefits that trees provide, for example.

name: Bathing water quality
description: Bathing waters in England that are monitored in order to meet UK reporting obligations under the EU Bathing Water Directive. View and download data about individual bathing waters or select and compare groups of bathing waters. There are two sampling sites in Plymouth: Plymouth Hoe East and Plymouth Hoe West.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated May, 2022.
use_this_to: Find out about historical pollution incidents and / or abnormal situations, as well as access pollution risk forecasts and the levels of E. coli in bathing waters, for example.

name: Swimfo app
description: Look up details of a designated bathing water by name or location and view on a map.

name: Create signage.
description: An application to create a sign for one or more bathing waters that you control.

name: Brownfield Land Register - Plymouth
description: PCC’s register of brownfield land suitable for housing development in accordance with legislation and Government guidance.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated December, 2021.
use_this_to: Find suitable locations for building new and “green” homes, for example.

name: Local Nature Reserves
description: Name, area and location of Local Nature Reserves within Plymouth as of November 2019.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated in 2019.
use_this_to: Create maps that display the location of nature reserves within Plymouth, and find out who owns each reserve, for example.

name: Sports Pitches - Plymouth
description: Data showing details on the playing and sports pitches in Plymouth.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated in 2018.

name: Plymouth Urban Fringe Landscape Areas
description: Data showing the extent of different urban fringe character areas as defined by the Plymouth and Plymouth Urban Fringe Landscape and Seascape Assessment.

name: Plymouth Landscape Character Areas
description: Data showing the extent of different landscape character areas in Plymouth as defined by the Plymouth and Plymouth Urban Fringe Landscape and Seascape Assessment.

name: Energy - Plymouth
description: A variety of multiple datasets showing energy statistics in Plymouth. This data is taken from both internal sources in Plymouth City Council departments and the Local Government data source and the Census of 2011.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Update due with release of 2021 Census data.
use_this_to: Find out domestic energy consumption in Plymouth, for example.

name: Transport - Plymouth
description: A variety of multiple datasets showing transport statistics in Plymouth. This data is taken from both internal sources in Plymouth City Council departments and the Local Government data source and the Census of 2011.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Update due with release of 2021 Census data.
use_this_to: Find out how people travel to work in Plymouth, for example.

name: National Trust land datasets
description: Open data from the National Trust.
use_this_to: Find out information about National Trust sites in England, Wales and Northern Ireland.

name: Land - Always Open.
description: National Trust land to which the public has access on foot only – either by right (in the case of designated ‘Access Land’ under the Countryside (Rights of Way) Act 2000 (CRoW)) or by permission from the National Trust. Last updated: 2021.

name: Land - Limited Access.
description: National Trust land where the public can access at certain times, or after paying an admission charge, or where access is limited to footpaths. Last updated: 2021.

name: Mapping our Shores - data.
description: Coastal land use data.

name: Mapping our Shores - map tool.
description: View coastal land use data on a map.

name: National Parks (England)
description: Geospatial data showing the location of National Parks in England.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated December, 2021.
use_this_to: Download the data in the format that you require.

name: UK-AIR
description: Automatic air quality monitoring stations measuring oxides of nitrogen (NOx), sulphur dioxide (SO2), ozone (O3), carbon monoxide (CO) and particles (PM10, PM2.5).
update_freq: Data update frequency: Daily.
use_this_to: Find out the level of air pollution in the city centre and use as evidence to advocate for a switch to more sustainable transport, for example.

name: Data Selector.
description: Access data and simple statistics from the UK-AIR database. Search hourly networks, or daily and multi-day networks.

name: Annual and exceedance statistics.
description: This tool allows you to choose the monitoring network, pollutant, metric, sites and time period you are interested in and it returns the chosen statistics. Examples are annual mean, daily maximum concentrations and number of exceedances of the Air Quality Strategy objectives and European limit values.

name: Openair.
description: Provides free and open-source tools to analyse, interpret and understand air pollution data using R. This website makes it straightforward to download these graphical outputs from Openair in document ready formats.

name: UK-Air API.
description: Machine readable access point for air pollution measurements hosted on UK-AIR.

name: National Atmospheric Emissions Inventory (NAEI)
description: Download UK emission data by air pollutants, greenhouse gases, heavy metals, particulate matter, and emission factors, which are detailed by source and fuel. You can also download this data as pivot tables.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Annually.

name: Interactive map.
description: A user-friendly interface of the UK emission maps which allows the users to explore and interrogate the data at a variety of scales and perform data queries using simple click and select buttons.

name: Pesticide usage statistics
description: Open data containing information about nearly 30 years of pesticide usage from CRD (Chemical Regulation Division) funded surveys.
use_this_to: Find data showing the total area treated by a particular pesticide and on a particular crop type, for example.

name: Food Standards Agency open data catalogue
description: A range of data about food and food safety.
use_this_to: Find food hygiene ratings or inspection results given to businesses in your local area, for example.

name: Protected Planet
description: The “most up to date and complete” source of data on protected areas and other effective area-based conservation measures (OECMs). Includes multiple datasets relating to Plymouth.
publisher: Submissions from governments, non-governmental organisations, landowners and communities.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Monthly.

name: Datastro
description: An open data portal about astronomy. Including charts, graphs, maps and pictures.
use_this_to: Find data for planning night time observation events, for example.

name: High Speed 2 Limited (HS2)
description: Open data relating to HS2, the high speed train line currently being built (2022) in Britain, running from London to the North-West.
use_this_to: Access environmental monitoring and ecological survey data collected as part of the HS2 project.

name: The Copernicus Open Access Hub
description: Part of the EU Space Programme. The UK will continue to participate until at least 2027. Satellite data enables efficient mapping and monitoring of the Earth’s resources, ecosystems, and events.
use_this_to: Find data to gain insights about the effects of the human population and human activities on cities and environments, to enable data-based decision making. For example <add info>.

name: Dartmoor National Park (DNP)
description: All open datasets accessible via data.gov.uk.
use_this_to: Find out information about Dartmoor National Park.

name: Rare Bird Nesting Areas.
description: Shows areas where rare birds nest on the high moor and includes recommended crossing tracks. Primarily used as guidance for the Ten Tors’ participants so that they don’t inadvertently stray into sensitive bird habitats. Updated annually.

name: Dartmoor Site Allocations.
description: The data shows areas which have been identified in DNP's development plan document (part of the Local Plan) as being areas for special policy reference, or allocation. Last update: 2020.

name: Dartmoor Brownfield Sites.
description: List of Brownfield Sites within DNP. Last update: 2020.

name: Dartmoor Neighbourhood Plan Areas.
description: The extent of the neighbourhood plan areas within DNP. Last update: 2016.

name: Conservation Areas.
description: Designated areas of 'special architectural or historic interest' whose character or appearance is worth protecting or enhancing. Last update: 2020.

name: Wild Camping Permitted.
description: Areas of DNP where camping is permitted. Last update: 2020.

name: DNPA Woodland of Conservation Importance.
description: Shapefile that combines the original Section 3 Woodland layer (Dataset 47) with the Ancient Woodland Inventory published by Natural England (Dataset 158). Last update: 2020.

name: DNPA Land Owned or Leased.
description: The location of public land and building assets within DNP. Last update: 2020.

name: Forestry Commission Open Data Site
description: Open spatial data that can be used in Geographic Information Systems (GIS).
use_this_to: Find information about tree pest and disease prevalence in a given area, or species of tree, for example.

name: Tree species database.
description: Information on over 60 tree species that are either widely grown in British forests at the present time or which could play an increasing role in the future.

name: Seed storage database.
description: Find out about seed characteristics and how best to store them.

name: Alternative access to data.
description: The Forestry Commission also publishes many open non-spatial datasets; it is recommended that you go to data.gov.uk to find these.

name: Natural England Open Data Geoportal
description: Provides free and open access to the definitive source of geographic products, web applications, story maps, services and APIs.
use_this_to: Find out information about the features of a Marine Conservation Zone, for example.

name: Natural England datasets on data.gov.uk
description: Access the open data via Gov.uk. Caveat: over 4,000 datasets.

name: Green Infrastructure Map.
description: Designed to provide technical evidence on the Green Infrastructure of England as an open data product.

name: Defra Data Services Platform
description: Designed to make environmental data openly available to a wide range of users. The more people know about the environment, the better informed will be their actions and decisions that can help safeguard our natural environment, support our food and farming industry and sustain a thriving rural economy. All their data can also be found in the data.gov.uk catalogue.

name: Asset Management.
description: Datasets that show flood defences currently owned, managed or inspected by the EA. Use for flood and coastal erosion risk management.

name: Asset information
description: Map - explore key asset management datasets.

name: Bathing Waters.
description: Datasets that show bathing water quality. Use it to report on bathing water quality in your area.

name: Catchment Data.
description: Access data about the water environment. It supports and builds upon the data in the river basin management plans. Find out about the biological and physico- chemical quality of a specific river and compare with others.

name: Catchment Data Explorer.
description: Map - explore and download information about the water environment in your area and access river basin management plans.

name: Ecology and Fish.
description: Access freshwater fish data, as well as freshwater and marine ecology survey data. The collated data can be queried in a consistent way. Use it to analyse trends in changes to fish populations.

name: Data Explorer.
description: Map - search ecology and fish data by location, species, survey date.

name: Magic.
description: Map - includes datasets from Natural England, Defra, Environment Agency, Historic England, Forestry Commission and Marine Management Organisation.

name: Flood Monitoring.
description: Data showing flood areas, flood warnings, measurement stations and measures (water level, flow, wind, temperature). Identify areas that require improved flood defence infrastructure as a priority.

name: Live flood map.
description: Map - view river, sea, groundwater and rainfall levels, and type of flood warnings that have been issued.

name: Reservoir flood map.
description: Map - shows where water may go in the very unlikely event of a reservoir failure.

name: Hydrology
description: Provides access to historic water flow information, complementing the near real-time data provided under flood monitoring (above) in that it provides access to a long term archive of quality checked and qualified data.

name: Hydrology Data Explorer.
description: Map - river flows and groundwater readings for stations throughout England.

name: Public Registers.
description: Licence applications from industry, business and individuals to carry out certain activities that have the potential to pollute the environment. Find out whether a certain business has a permit to store radioactive substances.

name: Public Registers Online.
description: Search Defra’s list of public registers on their website.

name: Rainfall
description: Approximately 1000 real time rain gauges measuring the amount of precipitation (mm) and capturing in Tipping Bucket Rain Gauges (TBR). <use>

name: Rainfall Demonstra-tor.
description: Map - explore and download data from the network of tipping-gauge rainfall sensors.

name: Tide Gauge.
description: Tidal elevations at 44 locations around the UK coast. Near real time measurements provide mean sea level and are reported both relative to local datum (unit m) and relative to the Ordnance Datum at Newlyn (unit mAOD). <use>

name: Tide gauge readings.
description: Map - browse and download data from stations of the UK National Tide Gauge Network.

name: Water Quality Data Archive.
description: Water sampling data from 58 thousand sampling points that measure aspects of the water quality or the environment at the sampling point. <use>

name: Water quality archive.
description: Map - search sampling points in the archive by providing one or more of the search criteria.

name: Drinking water.
description: Map - search for Drinking Water Safeguard Zones and NVZs (nitrate vulnerable zones).

name: Environmental Information Data Centre (EIDC) Open Data Catalogue
description: Holds terrestrial, freshwater and atmospheric environmental data generated by researchers in the UK, most of which is freely accessible and available under Open Licence arrangements. Part of NERC’s Environmental Data Service, hosted by the UK Centre for Ecology & Hydrology (UKCEH).
use_this_to: Access data from hedgerow management and biodiversity restoration experiments and use it to guide your own restoration or rewilding project, for example.

name: Joint Nature Conservation Committee (JNCC) open data
description: Access a broad range of nature and environmental data.
use_this_to: Find details of the conservation designations of over 13,000 UK taxa that have been assigned some form of rarity, threat or legal status, or access spatial datasets containing Special Areas of Conservation, for example.

name: JNCC Data Inventory.
description: Public inventory of data assets maintained or held by JNCC. The inventory includes but is not limited to datasets published as open data.

name: OSPAR Data & Information Management System
description: An online tool providing a single point of access to all the data and information gathered through OSPAR’s Joint Assessment and Monitoring Programme across the different thematic work areas of the Convention (The Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic).
use_this_to: Find out the levels and trends in marine contaminants and their biological effects, for example.

name: NBN Atlas
description: The UK’s largest repository of publicly available biodiversity data. Includes datasets from The Biological Records Centre, such as from iRecord and surveys.
use_this_to: Search for a species of interest, view their distribution on a map, and download the related data, for example.

name: EasyMap.
description: A service provided by the NBN Gateway that enables you to get a live NBN map on your website in one line of HTML.

name: Centre for Environment, Fisheries & Aquaculture Science (CEFAS) Data Portal
description: Contains 2109 metadata records, with 5771 data sets available to download and connect to in support of their “commitment to open science”.
use_this_to: Find out the spawning and nesting grounds of selected fish in UK waters, access data from biological surveys, or GIS layers that provide information about inshore fishing activities intensity, for example.

name: OpenGeoscience
description:
A free service where you can view maps and download data, scans, photos and other information relating to the geology of the UK.
API server: https://ogcapi.bgs.ac.uk/

name: Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy (BEIS)
description: All open datasets from this publisher on the Gov.uk open data portal.

name: The Open Geography Portal
description: Provides free and open access to a definitive source of geographic products, web applications, story maps, services and APIs.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Mostly updated on a weekly or daily basis. Exceptions: ward boundary changes and local authority district changes are routinely implemented annually, Westminster parliamentary constituency changes coincide with a General Election and health area, parish changes can occur at any time.
use_this_to: Looking up a postcode and, for example, finding out which organisation(s) has responsibility for maintenance of green spaces in your area.

name: Postcode products
description: The ONS Postcode Directory (ONSPD) and the National Statistics Postcode Lookup (NSPL) - two key postcode products that assign geographies to postcodes using two different methodologies, depending on your requirements.

name: CodePoint-Open
description: Another open dataset from a different publisher of all the current postcode units, NHS authority and administrative unit codes, and related location information in Great Britain.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Quarterly.
use_this_to: Link any dataset that includes postcode data to the postcode location and visualise on a map. This could be used to see where similar projects are currently being delivered and identify opportunities, for example.

name: Ordnance Survey Open UPRN
description: A dataset of unique identifiers for every addressable location in Great Britain, containing all Unique Property Reference Numbers (UPRNs) and geometry from AddressBase Premium (an OS product).
update_freq: Data update frequency: Six weeks.
use_this_to: Similar to CodePoint-Open, but uses UPRNs instead of postcode units.

name: Location of empty homes in Plymouth
description: The postcodes and geographic location data of Empty Homes across Plymouth for the year 2017.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated 2017.

name: Number of dwellings.
description: Data showing the number of dwellings in Plymouth from 2008-2016.

name: Vacancy Atlas.
description: A toolkit from Real Ideas Organisation designed to help individuals and organisations find and gain access to vacant spaces, develop a plan of action for the project and space and understand the legal obligations and manage the risks involved.

name: Planning Applications - Plymouth
description: Information on historical planning applications.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Data available from 1969 to 2015.

name: Planning compliments and complaints.
description: Data showing the amount of compliments and complaints received by Plymouth City Council's planning (now Strategic Planning and Infrastructure) department.

name: Valid planning applications.
description: Data showing information on planning applications in Plymouth. From 1999 to 2016.

name: Planning performance.
description: Data showing information on planning applications in Plymouth. From 1999 to 2016.

name: Stalled planning sites.
description: Details of the lapsed or stalled planning applications in Plymouth City Council, from 2006 to 2016.

name: Libraries - Plymouth
description: Information on Plymouth’s libraries including location, opening times and facilities.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Last updated 2019.

name: Active library users by age.
description: A dataset showing the number of active library users by age band.

name: Library issues.
description: Weekly issues by library in 2018.

name: Census data
description: From 2011 census. ONS is due to start releasing 2021 data at the end of May, 2022.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Survey occurs every 10 years.
use_this_to: Understand the demographics of the public in the area that your project operates to identify needs <add info>.

name: Data tables from 2011 Census.
description: Download the full index of tables and topics as an Excel Macro-Enabled worksheet.

name: Indices of Multiple Deprivation (IMD)
description: A relative measure of deprivation, meaning it can tell you if one area is more deprived than another but not by how much. For example, a small area with a rank of 1,000 is not half as deprived as a place with a rank of 500. Covers a wider range of measures including environment, barriers to opportunity, health and crime
publisher: Department of Levelling Up, Housing & Communities
update_freq: Data update frequency: Typically updated every 3 to 4 years - last updated 2019.
use_this_to: Classify the relative deprivation of small geographical areas within the UK, which can be a strong supporting factor for bids and grant applications. For example, to evidence the need for green spaces for improved mental wellbeing and / or physical wellbeing in your area.

name: IMD Map
description: Explore the Indices of Deprivation 2015 and 2019 in an interactive map. You can choose the overall Index of Multiple Deprivation, or one of the individual domains. You can search the map by place name or postcode.
publisher: Department of Levelling Up, Housing & Communities

name: IMD Postcode Lookup
description: A tool to obtain deprivation data for up to 10,000 postcodes at a time. You can also look up deprivation data by local authority.
publisher: Department of Levelling Up, Housing & Communities

name: IoD2019 Interactive Dashboard.
description: Allows users to explore the 2019 English Indices of Deprivation data at both local authority district level and neighbourhood (LSOA) level.
publisher: Department of Levelling Up, Housing & Communities

name: Nomisweb
description: A service to access the most detailed and up-to-date UK labour market statistics from official sources. Includes datasets relating to income, employment, population and much more.
publisher: The University of Durham provides the Nomis service on behalf of the Office for National Statistics

name: Query data tool
description: Create a data download from one of the full range of data sets. Data is available at a very detailed level.
publisher: The University of Durham provides the Nomis service on behalf of the Office for National Statistics

name: Local Area Report search tool
description: Information about your local area (including Parish, County, District and smaller areas). Includes personal characteristics of people who usually live in an area, characteristics of the households we live in and work-related topics.
publisher: The University of Durham provides the Nomis service on behalf of the Office for National Statistics

name: GrantNav
description: Search, explore and download grants data published by UK funders in the 360Giving Data Standard.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Daily.
use_this_to: Find out how funding is allocated in your local area, including funder and recipient information, plus the amount of funding that was received at any given time.

name: Grant Finder
description: Comprehensive database of grant funding opportunities, available in some areas for free via a local LEP or library service.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Daily.
use_this_to: Find relevant funding opportunities for your project / organisation.

name: NHS open data
description: Provide national IT and data services that support clinicians at work, help patients get the best care, and use data to improve health and care.

name: Public health statistics
description: Official statistics based on datasets relating to a very wide range of public health topics. A comprehensive list is available via the link.
publisher: Office for Health Improvement and Disparities

name: Health Inequalities Dashboard
description: A tool to assist monitoring and evidencing progress on reducing inequalities within England.

name: Public Health Dashboard
description: The purpose of the dashboard is to support local decision-making by bringing existing comparative data into one place and making it accessible and meaningful to a wide audience. Select an indicator to see variance across England and how your local area compares.

name: Public Health Profiles.
description: Provide an overview of health for each local authority in England. They pull together existing information in one place and contain data on a range of indicators for local populations, highlighting issues that can affect health in each locality.

name: Health and social care
description: Over 150 open datasets published on the data.gov website.
publisher: Department of Health and Social Care

name: Education
description: View all of the open data available and choose files to download in the data catalogue, browse statistical summaries and download associated data, and create your own data tables.

name: Traveller caravan count
description: Compiled from information submitted by local authorities in England in order to provide local data on the number and seasonal movement of caravans and trends over time. Includes records of the number of caravans on both authorised and unauthorised sites across England.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Biannually (January and July).

name: Local Needs Databank
description: Can increase your understanding of needs and charity work across the UK by bringing together official statistics, such as those on multiple deprivation, age, health and ethnicity, and data on local charity density and charity demand data from organisations such as Turn2us, Buttle UK and British Gas Energy Trust.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Weekly, or as soon as new data is released from external sources.

name: Data download
description: Link for a direct download of all data within the Local Needs Databank as an .xlsx file. Includes metadata information and source links.

name: Explore and Compare Dashboard
description: Produce your own tailored, interactive data reports on the places and needs that matter most to you and your work.

name: LGInform
description: Find up-to-date published data about your local area and the performance of your council or fire and rescue authority. Topics include: employment, community safety, housing, health and social care, education, culture, permits and permissions, environmental protection and more.

name: Local Green Jobs.
description: Report provides analysis of the jobs required for a net zero economy in England, and where these will be located in the coming years. Raw data available to download.

name: Democracy Club
description: Find information about local government and elections in the UK. From knowing where to vote, to finding out what is happening in your council.
update_freq: Data update frequency: Ad hoc subject to elections.
use_this_to: Find out about upcoming elections; when they are taking place and the location of polling stations.

name: Who can I vote for?
description: Information about candidates standing for political office in the UK.

name: Companies House register
description: Find and update company information, including the registered address and date of incorporation, current and resigned officers, document images, mortgage charge data, previous company names and insolvency information.
update_freq: Data update frequency: “Regularly”.

name: Voluntary Sector data resources
description: A range of quantitative resources and sources of data for those researching the voluntary sector.
use_this_to: Find other resources and tools for exploring data related to the voluntary sector.

name: Charity Classification Tags.
description: An additional classification system to the International Classification of Non-profit and Third Sector Organisations (ICNP/TSO), designed with the aim to make classifications more specific to the UK, and to allow charities to be associated with several tags at once.

name: Charities Register
description: Information from the Charity Commission about registered charities in England and Wales, including charity name and address, trustees, work and aims, and finances. There are different registers for charities in Scotland and charities in Northern Ireland (see below).
use_this_to: Find out the number of trustees at any given charity and whether they receive any remuneration, payments or benefits from the charity, for example.

name: OpenDataMonitor
description: An overview of available open data resources in EU countries and the UK.
use_this_to: Browse and search for open datasets. Compare the amount of open data and its completeness by country.

name: 30 Days Wild
description: Dandelion survey data

name: EMODnet (European Marine Observation and Data Network)
description: Seven different portals - Bathymetry, chemistry, biology, geology, human activities, physics, seabed habitats.

name: Geoviewer.
description: Map view of data. Many layers available covering the SW of England.

name: Natural Environment Research Council (NERC) Data Catalogue Service
description: Search for data resources from NERC's five umbrella data centres. The catalogue connects data held in managed archives and by individual research groups.

name: British Oceanographic Data Centre.
description: Marine.

name: Environmental Information Data Centre.
description: Terrestrial and freshwater.

name: Centre for Environmental Data Analysis.
description: Atmospheric, earth observation, and solar and space physics.

name: National Geoscience Data Centre.
description: Geoscience.

name: UK Polar Data Centre.
description: Polar and cryosphere.
